summary: Sophie mentioned that Sansa’s main motivation in surviving all of these horrible years was for her family, and she also...
body: Sophie mentioned that Sansa’s main motivation in surviving all of these horrible years was for her family, and she also mentioned how there’s a definitive power in family and unity. She even went on about how Ned Stark would be proud of seeing the Starks kids where they are now, and how she thinks the main message of the show is that family is everything. Does this sound like the words of an actress whose character ended up betraying her family in order to get power? Does this sound like the words of an actress whose character turned out exactly like Littlefinger, flaws and all? No, it clearly doesn’t. Rather, it sounds like the words of an actress who read the script of the last season, and realized how important the unity in the Stark family will be in surviving through the long night, and the end of the game of thrones. It sounds like the words of an actress who portrayed a character whose main motivation at the moment is keeping her home and her family safe. That sounds like the words on an actress who portrays a character who is just as much part of her family as the other members.

No, it clearly doesn’t. Rather, it sounds like the words of an actress who read the script of the last season, and realized how important the unity in the Stark family will be in surviving through the long night, and the end of the game of thrones. summary: I think a lot of people on here misinterpret Sophie Turner when it comes to her feelings about Sansa. They often talk about she...
body: I think a lot of people on here misinterpret Sophie Turner when it comes to her feelings about Sansa. They often talk about she doesn’t really love her character either because she was jealous of many of the other actresses because they ended up in roles where the characters they played got to be strong in a more traditionally masculine and accepted manner or because she sees the moments in which Sansa causes the death of some of the villains in the story as being empowering, and I would honestly disagree with these people. She does love Sansa, and she does understand her. She used to cry herself to sleep because of how sad she was for her character that went through such a hard and terrible journey. Not just that, but many of you don’t understand that Sophie was a teenage girl. She would watch all of the other major actresses get celebrated and lauded for portraying these other types of female characters whereas she, who played a character who found her strength in her femininity, was often ignored and simply didn’t receive a warm reception. She wanted to feel validated. She wanted to see this character that she is so attached to be respected by the fans. Even when she was jealous, she still loved Sansa, she still saw her as a powerful character, and understood what made her strong. When she got older, she understood that so many people ignored her character because for them, a strong female character was one who would swing a sword mass murder and physically be very strong. She even called people out on that, and stated that they should also cheer for the female characters that wear dresses and are instead emotionally and intellectually very strong like Sansa. Yes scenes like Ramsey’s death and Littlefinger’s execution had people praise Sansa because she did something that fit more with strength linked to traditional masculinity, but with that being said, it’s clear that Sophie doesn’t just appreciate these moments when it comes to Sansa’s character, but the whole kaleidoscope that is Sansa, and that very much includes the moments in the earlier seasons where her strength lied in the fact that she never compromised her identity, her motivation to live or her morals because of the abuse she suffered. I really couldn’t ask for someone better to not only portray but also constantly defend Sansa Stark.

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

summary: I've been hating the rampant fake feminism in the GoT fandom since I joined it but the last bit of hate that we saw against...
caption:
I’ve been hating the rampant fake feminism in the GoT fandom since I joined it but the last bit of hate that we saw against Arya, Sansa AND Maisie AND Sophie ( because if you are a nasty hater, of course, you need to attack the actors too when you disagree with the characters actions) is really awful.

If your idea of feminism is convenient only when it supports one female character than it’s bs, not feminism.

summary: Do you have pics o
question: Do you have pics o
answer: Hello there. I was looking for the posts that I’ve watched all morning (where i live) and none came … Not even the things i liked. So apparently they are deleted. No i don’t have them … Sorry … Still the thing is that they bashed on Maisie for saying that Arya will be by her sister’s side and will call out Jon for bending the knee. And how it’s gonna be Jonærice vs the world. Most of the /ff used to bash on Nikolaj (for his beliefs abt Dæny) and now since the Friki spoils they turned on Lady Lyanna and Sam… So i guess they are on a constant whining phase.

summary: I would love it if Arya stands up for or vocally defends Sansa. I don't know if it'll happen. Generally it's GA's faves vs...
question: I would love it if Arya stands up for or vocally defends Sansa. I don't know if it'll happen. Generally it's GA's faves vs Sansa. Everything's blamed on Sansa by the fandom. I'd love to see more characters supporting Sansa. Reddit, for sure, will have a meltdown.
answer: Maisie said it’ll happen so there’s that. Honestly though I am weary of only Sansa telling people they suck, I’m glad she stands up to them and tries to make sure they respect her

summary: “What have they done to break my little bird?”  Inspired by the story: Running, Returning, from ricketyrunt “Little bird…” His...
caption:
“What have they done to break my little bird?”

Inspired by the story: Running, Returning, from ricketyrunt

“Little bird…” His voice was hardly a whisper, his eyes stinging as she reached for him, pressed kisses into his palm, his wrist, his burned forearm. He closed his eyes and bent his head down to hers. “I’m so sorry, I didn’t know…”

summary: There has been more talk and ready acceptance in this fandom of Sansa being the villian, Sansa betraying Jon, Sansa being in...
question: There has been more talk and ready acceptance in this fandom of Sansa being the villian, Sansa betraying Jon, Sansa being in cahoots w/ LF than there has been of Daenerys being a white savior and the white savior trope in her arc. So many were all about Sansa backstabbing Jon and being power hungry;there were polls et al. But any mention of D's white saviorism & white feminism is a big no no (calling out the BNFs for this behavior)
answer: Of course Daenerys is a fan favourite and the fandom is mostly white. How many people you know want to genuinely examine and critique racism in their favourite character’s storyline? Sansa is a polarising character with many antis and since they can’t hate her for being feminine anymore, they struggle to find a legitimate reason. Anyone with more than 3 brain cells knows she’s not a villain but it’s better for them to pretend she’ll die disgraced than to accept she’s an important character who won’t make herself small if she disagrees with their faves. They really thought Sansa was a side character because they can’t imagine a girl like her being important and so they’re throwing temper tantrums.

Anyone with more than 3 brain cells knows she’s not a villain but it’s better for them to pretend she’ll die disgraced than to accept she’s an important character who won’t make herself small if she disagrees with their faves. They really thought Sansa was a side character because they can’t imagine a girl like her being important and so they’re throwing temper tantrums.

Anyone with more than 3 brain cells knows she’s not a villain but it’s better for them to pretend she’ll die disgraced than to accept she’s an important character who won’t make herself small if she disagrees with their faves. They really thought Sansa was a side character because they can’t imagine a girl like her being important and so they’re throwing temper tantrums.

blog.name: arabian-bloodstream
blog.title: arabian_bloodstream
blog.description: AdamDriver. MaisieWilliams. JoeDempsie. DemiLovato. KellyClarkson. WashingtonCapitals. TheVampireDiaries. GameofThrones. StarWars. AryaxGendry. Reylo. DamonxElena. Caryl. AryaStark. CarolPeletier.

summary: Know the Characters You Ship!
title: Know the Characters You Ship!
body:
You know why all of the ridiculous Sansa and Gendry crackpot theories annoy me? It has nothing to do with the fact that I am a die-hard, stripped to the bone Arya/Gendry shipper (OK, maybe a little bit of that) or that Sansa and Tyrion are my third favorite pairing (and a wee bit of this) on the show. Mostly, it’s because it’s not fair to Gendry. Look, I get that Gendry is not an “important” character. He falls in the tertiary supporting character category, but I love him. He’s actually my fourth favorite character in the entire series; I literally love every single moment that guy is on screen.

And frankly, the idea of Gendry with Sansa is insulting to Gendry. No, not because Sansa is this terrible character, because she’s not. But she’d be terrible to and for Gendry. Randomly deciding that Gendry would hook up with Sansa just shows a complete disregard for HIS character. Nothing about Sansa would appeal to who HE is, his upbringing, his life and what has shaped HIM as a person. Everyone (and let’s be honest, it’s mostly Sansa fans who just want to see her get a handsome, good guy) who thinks of pairing these two up is *only* thinking of Sansa. They aren’t thinking of Gendry! They clearly haven’t a clue of who this guy really is and what he has been through.

- Gendry does not like highborns because whenever they come around, he gets screwed over. He gets sold, threatened, lied to, nearly killed, kidnapped, almost eaten alive by a rat, living in fear of death every day, kidnapped (again), sold (again), raped*, and almost burned alive. This all happened whenever he was introduced to a Lord or Lady. (Except Arya, but of course, he wasn’t introduced to her as a Lady… he knew her well before then.)

* Yes, it may have started out nicely for him, but what Melisandre did to him was rape. She took advantage of a naive, awestruck virgin boy who’d never seen a naked woman before and in about ten seconds flat had him naked and on his back. In not much more than a minute after that, she had him tied up against his will, scared out of his mind and begging her to let him go before putting leeches on his body, including his privates. Flip the scenario, imagine that Melisandre is a man, and Gendry a girl. Pretty obviously rape, isn’t it?

And, no, just because Gendry went through this situation doesn’t mean that he would *understand* what Sansa went through. What she went through was about a thousand times worse and were Gendry EVER try to console her by comparing the two it would be just the worst. So Gendry never would because Gendry is the BEST!

- Gendry hasn’t had the best experiences with redheads. See * above.

- Gendry *may* be the son of Robert Baratheon, but he’s also a bastard. However, he’s not a bastard like Jon Snow who was raised by a noble family. Gendry was raised in the slums of King’s Landing, an orphan of Flea Bottom. Contrary to fandom’s determination to give him the surname of “Waters,” he doesn’t actually *have* a surname. He’s JUST Gendry because only bastards who have been acknowledged by their fathers have surnames. Gendry is not Gendry Waters anymore than he is Gendry Baratheon. He’s just Gendry. He’s a bastard from Flea Bottom with no highborn manners or training.

Gendry is someone that Sansa Stark would NEVER, EVER see herself with unless absolutely forced to be with. Why? Because he is a bastard from Flea Bottom with no highborn manners or training. It doesn’t matter how blue his eyes are or how great his abs are or how hot he is. She wouldn’t even notice him to see the blue, the abs, the hot. Sansa is not the same spoiled, vain girl she was in the early seasons, but she’s still a Lady and a Lady does not notice, does not fraternize with bastards from Flea Bottom. THAT is something that Arya does… Arya fraternizes with EVERYBODY, the servants, the butcher’s boys, the bastards.

Gendry is hot, yeah… but nothing at ALL in his character in any way, shape or form narratively makes sense for him and Sansa. For either character. Not for her, and definitely not for him.

Gendry and Arya, on the other hand… well, they have a history, they have a love song, they’ve endured hardships together, Arya is the only nobleperson that Gendry has had good experiences with precisely because she doesn’t act like a nobleperson.

So, TLDR… before people start randomly shipping Sansa with random good-looking guys on the show, at least know that character’s history first and whether or not it would actually, you know, make any fucking sense. In Gendry’s case… it emphatically DOES NOT!

blog.name: wicnet
blog.title: Winter is Coming
blog.description: WinterIsComing.net is on Tumblr. Bringing you Game of Thrones news, rumors, speculation, screencaps, GIFs, fan art, memes, and more.

summary: Will #GameofThrones cut to black like The Sopranos? Whatever happened to Maisie Williams' New Mutants movie? All that and more...
